intro: Puccinellia iberica, commonly known as the Iberian glassworts, is a flowering plant species native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its succulent, often hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in saline or alkaline soils, often found in coastal areas and salt marshes. It has a low-growing habit and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Puccinellia iberica plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for various small organisms.
